title: When Trump said 'I think I was right' after 'Kamala Harris Black or Indian' remark
content: Donald Trump is adamant on his comment doubting Kamala Harris' ethnicity between Black and Indian though his campaign might have suffered from the remark that he first made in Chicago. Trump said he was not sure whether Kamala Harris was Indian or Black because before 'turning' Black, Kamala Harris emphasized on his Indian roots.
summary: Donald Trump is adamant on his comment doubting Kamala Harris' ethnicity between Black and Indian though his campaign might have suffered from the remark that he first made in Chicago. Trump said he was not sure whether Kamala Harris was Indian or Black because before 'turning' Black, Kamala Harris emphasized on his Indian roots.

title: Joe Rogan's flip-flop on Donald Trump and RFK Jr: "Most American f***ing things'
content: Joe Rogan offered the quickest flip-flop as he on Thursday endorsed Robert F Kennedy Jr's independent presidential campaign and then on Friday said Donald Trump's action of raising his fist after a bullet grazed his ear was "one of the most American f***ing things of all time".
summary: Joe Rogan offered the quickest flip-flop as he on Thursday endorsed Robert F Kennedy Jr's independent presidential campaign and then on Friday said Donald Trump's action of raising his fist after a bullet grazed his ear was "one of the most American f***ing things of all time".

title: 'I couldn't care less': Did Trump explain why he calls Harris 'Kamabla'?
content: Former president Donald Trump has been referring to Kamala Harris as 'Kamabla' -- a term which has no explained meaning. There are speculations that it is a willful distortion of Kamala's name to incorporate Black in it, or that Trump has been suggesting that 'Kamala Harris is blah'. But there has been no explanation given until Trump addressed his habit of 'bad name calling'. At the rally, Trump said he has frequently mispronounced Kamala Harris' name but he couldn't care less how it should be pronounced.
summary: Former president Donald Trump has been referring to Kamala Harris as 'Kamabla' -- a term which has no explained meaning. There are speculations that it is a willful distortion of Kamala's name to incorporate Black in it, or that Trump has been suggesting that 'Kamala Harris is blah'. But there has been no explanation given until Trump addressed his habit of 'bad name calling'. At the rally, Trump said he has frequently mispronounced Kamala Harris' name but he couldn't care less how it should be pronounced.

title: ​Global leaders in industrial automation: Top countries by robotic integration
'Angry' Donald Trump calls NYT over helicopter fact check: 'Yes, he was in a scary ride'
content: The New York Times Saturday published a report confirming that Donald Trump was indeed on a rocky helicopter ride as he earlier claimed. But it was not with Willie Brown, the former San Francisco mayor, Kamala Harris' ex-boyfriend as Trump claimed in his press conference Thursday. On Friday, NYT said the 'jaw-dropping story' that Trump told about nearly dying in a helicopter ride actually never happened.
summary: The New York Times Saturday published a report confirming that Donald Trump was indeed on a rocky helicopter ride as he earlier claimed. But it was not with Willie Brown, the former San Francisco mayor, Kamala Harris' ex-boyfriend as Trump claimed in his press conference Thursday. On Friday, NYT said the 'jaw-dropping story' that Trump told about nearly dying in a helicopter ride actually never happened.

title: North Korea launches more trash balloons towards South Korea: Seoul military
Trump plays Kamala Harris' 'tough and bit*h' video at Montana rally: 'We are not weird'
content: If you listen to Kamala Harris' speech, you would not know that she has been running the country for four years, Donald Trump said at his Montana rally and then played a compilation of Kamala Harris' statements known as 'word salads'. The Montana rally Friday marked Donald Trump's return to the campaign after he took a hiatus and then addressed a press conference at his home Thursday,.
summary: If you listen to Kamala Harris' speech, you would not know that she has been running the country for four years, Donald Trump said at his Montana rally and then played a compilation of Kamala Harris' statements known as 'word salads'. The Montana rally Friday marked Donald Trump's return to the campaign after he took a hiatus and then addressed a press conference at his home Thursday,.

title: No, Tim Walz didn't carry weapons in war; Yes, he misspoke: Harris campaign clarifies
content: Amid the ongoing controversy over Tim Walz's military record, whether he opted out of the service just before his unit's deployment in Iraq, the Harris-Walz campaign took a step back and admitted that yes, Tim Walz "misspoke" when he talked about carrying weapons in war -- in 2018. The video resurfaced after Walz's rival Ohio senator JD Vance called Walz's military record as "stolen valor" and that he never went to war.
summary: Amid the ongoing controversy over Tim Walz's military record, whether he opted out of the service just before his unit's deployment in Iraq, the Harris-Walz campaign took a step back and admitted that yes, Tim Walz "misspoke" when he talked about carrying weapons in war -- in 2018. The video resurfaced after Walz's rival Ohio senator JD Vance called Walz's military record as "stolen valor" and that he never went to war.

title: Sierra Leone court sentences soldiers to long jail terms for failed coup
content: The sentences were read out in court late on Friday with the judge handing out prison terms ranging from 50 and 120 years on those convicted.
summary: The sentences were read out in court late on Friday with the judge handing out prison terms ranging from 50 and 120 years on those convicted.

title: Bangladesh crisis: Why protesting students forced Chief Justice to resign
content: "I feel it is necessary to share a special news with you. Our chief justice has resigned a few minutes back. His resignation letter has already reached the law ministry. We will send it to the president without delay for taking necessary measures," Asif Nazrul, law, justice and parliamentary affairs adviser to the interim government, said.​​
summary: "I feel it is necessary to share a special news with you. Our chief justice has resigned a few minutes back. His resignation letter has already reached the law ministry. We will send it to the president without delay for taking necessary measures," Asif Nazrul, law, justice and parliamentary affairs adviser to the interim government,  said.​​

title: King Charles praises 'community spirit' in call for unity after UK's violent riots
content: King Charles III praised peaceful counter-protesters for their community spirit after far-right riots led to over 700 arrests. The riots followed a stabbing attack in Southport. In calls with PM Keir Starmer and police chiefs, the King expressed his gratitude to emergency services and hoped for unity based on mutual respect.
summary: King Charles III praised peaceful counter-protesters for their community spirit after far-right riots led to over 700 arrests. The riots followed a stabbing attack in Southport. In calls with PM Keir Starmer and police chiefs, the King expressed his gratitude to emergency services and hoped for unity based on mutual respect.

title: 'I can't even say ... ': Joe Biden on why he quit US presidential race
content: Joe Biden discussed his decision to withdraw from the presidential race in his first interview post-quitting. He emphasized the importance of defeating Donald Trump and unifying the Democratic Party. Biden's withdrawal followed a lackluster debate performance. He expressed concerns about Trump's potential reaction to losing, showing support for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz's campaign.
summary: Joe Biden discussed his decision to withdraw from the presidential race in his first interview post-quitting. He emphasized the importance of defeating Donald Trump and unifying the Democratic Party. Biden's withdrawal followed a lackluster debate performance. He expressed concerns about Trump's potential reaction to losing, showing support for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz's campaign.

title: Minorities faced 205 attacks after fall of Hasina-govt in Bangladesh: Hindu groups
content: Following the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government, Bangladesh has witnessed at least 205 attacks on minority communities in 52 districts. Hindu organizations have called on interim leader Muhammad Yunus to address the violence. Over 230 people have been killed, with numerous Hindu temples, homes, and businesses vandalized, escalating fears and uncertainties among minorities.
summary: Following the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government, Bangladesh has witnessed at least 205 attacks on minority communities in 52 districts. Hindu organizations have called on interim leader Muhammad Yunus to address the violence. Over 230 people have been killed, with numerous Hindu temples, homes, and businesses vandalized, escalating fears and uncertainties among minorities.

title: 'Potential sales restrictions on way': Japanese authorities warn people against hoarding as megaquake fears surge
content: Tokyo residents faced shortages of essential items as quake fears sparked a rush for disaster supplies. The government urged citizens to avoid panic buying. Demand surged after a 7.1-magnitude quake hit Japan's southern coast, and a 5.3 tremor near Tokyo caused further concern. Retailers reported high demand for disaster kits and daily necessities.
summary: Tokyo residents faced shortages of essential items as quake fears sparked a rush for disaster supplies. The government urged citizens to avoid panic buying. Demand surged after a 7.1-magnitude quake hit Japan's southern coast, and a 5.3 tremor near Tokyo caused further concern. Retailers reported high demand for disaster kits and daily necessities.

title: 'Wolf in sheep's clothing': Tim Walz’s 2022 gubernatorial opponent slams him
content: Former Minnesota Republican gubernatorial candidate Dr Scott Jensen criticized Democratic Vice President nominee Tim Walz as manipulative and unreliable. Jensen claimed Walz often fails to honor debate promises, citing the 2022 Minnesota gubernatorial race where expected statewide televised debates didn't occur, despite Walz's earlier assurances. Jensen warned Ohio Senator JD Vance about Walz's political strategies.
summary: Former Minnesota Republican gubernatorial candidate Dr Scott Jensen criticized Democratic Vice President nominee Tim Walz as manipulative and unreliable. Jensen claimed Walz often fails to honor debate promises, citing the 2022 Minnesota gubernatorial race where expected statewide televised debates didn't occur, despite Walz's earlier assurances. Jensen warned Ohio Senator JD Vance about Walz's political strategies.

title: Prince William and Kate 'disgusted' as prince Harry inherits $8.5m amid ongoing family feud: Report
content: Prince William and Kate Middleton felt disgusted as Prince Harry was set to receive an $8.5 million inheritance upon turning 40. The windfall from a trust fund established by Queen Elizabeth II intensified tensions within the royal family, particularly given Harry's recent withdrawal from royal duties and public criticism of the family.
summary: Prince William and Kate Middleton felt disgusted as Prince Harry was set to receive an $8.5 million inheritance upon turning 40. The windfall from a trust fund established by Queen Elizabeth II intensified tensions within the royal family, particularly given Harry's recent withdrawal from royal duties and public criticism of the family.

title: Brazil plane crash: How passenger no. 58 dodged death
New York City experiences light rain and winds as Debby moves towards Northeastern America
content: Northern Pennsylvania and Southern New York experienced flash floods due to Tropical Storm Debby, which initially hit Florida’s Gulf Coast as a category 1 hurricane. Officials ordered evacuations in parts of Pennsylvania, but some were lifted by evening. The storm caused disruptions, including flight delays, but New York City saw diminished rainfall impact compared to other regions.
summary: Northern Pennsylvania and Southern New York experienced flash floods due to Tropical Storm Debby, which initially hit Florida’s Gulf Coast as a category 1 hurricane. Officials ordered evacuations in parts of Pennsylvania, but some were lifted by evening. The storm caused disruptions, including flight delays, but New York City saw diminished rainfall impact compared to other regions.

title: US intel: Did share info to foil alleged IS plot targeting Taylor Swift Concert
content: US intelligence aided in thwarting a planned attack by Islamic State sympathizers at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna. Three individuals were arrested and charged with planning a suicide attack. This successful intervention emphasised the importance of international cooperation in combating terrorism and safeguarding public events, as confirmed by the White House.
summary: US intelligence aided in thwarting a planned attack by Islamic State sympathizers at a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna. Three individuals were arrested and charged with planning a suicide attack. This successful intervention emphasised the importance of international cooperation in combating terrorism and safeguarding public events, as confirmed by the White House.

title: 'Prince Harry thought King Charles would forgive him but ...': Expert
content: Prince Harry expected his father, King Charles, to make amends and forgive him, but tensions have instead heightened. Since Harry's departure from royal duties and his revealing memoir, Charles is reportedly furious and refuses to take his son's calls. The King is also concerned about potential future revelations from Meghan Markle.
summary: Prince Harry expected his father, King Charles, to make amends and forgive him, but tensions have instead heightened. Since Harry's departure from royal duties and his revealing memoir, Charles is reportedly furious and refuses to take his son's calls. The King is also concerned about potential future revelations from Meghan Markle.
